intro: Aster archerianus, commonly known as the Armenian aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Aster archerianus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
